NZUS01 KTFX 191923
RWSGTF
MTZ008>015-044>055-201300-
REGIONAL WEATHER SYNOPSIS
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE GREAT FALLS
130 PM MDT WED TUE 19 2014

A high pressure over the region will weaken and move to the east as 
a deep low pressure trough moves into the pacific northwest. A 
chance for isolated showers and thunderstorms for the north west and 
south west mountains. Temperatures are expected to be near seasonal 
along the divide and above seasonal averages on the central plains.

$$
